page.title: 04HOMELIFE IN TARBERT,HARRIS
page.content:
For this we concentrated on the most common items found in homes today,cars televisions,radios and computers.We also found the proportion of Gaelic speakers in our area because here a lot of the conversation in homes will be in Gaelic.
In all but one of the houses we visited there was a radio,87.9% of the houses owned a television,55.6% owned a car and only 8.3% owned a computer.
In all we surveyed 108 homes in which 280 people lived,189 of whom were Gaelic speakers and therefore bilingual.
